snippet: Dwight King’s goal in the third period Saturday started the Kings’ rally and incensed the Rangers’ Henrik Lundqvist, who said he could not move on the play.
abstract: New York Rangers and goaltender Henrik Lundqvist are incensed that Los Angeles Kings winger Dwight King did not receive a goalkeeper interference penalty for goal scored in the third period of Game 2 of the Stanley Cup finals, which started the Kings' rally from 4-2 deficit to a 5-4 victory in double overtime.

byline.contributor: Allan Kreda contributed reporting from White Plains.

lead_paragraph: Dwight King’s goal in the third period Saturday started the Kings’ rally and incensed the Rangers’ Henrik Lundqvist, who said he could not move on the play.

headline.main: Rangers Fume Over a Tangle in the Crease
headline.print_headline: Rangers Fume Over a Tangle in the Crease
